summary: Introduced in the House of Representatives by Mr. Kiley of California, this bill, H.R. 213, seeks to prohibit the use of any federal financial assistance for a specific high-speed rail development project in California. It explicitly targets the project associated with Cooperative Agreement No. FR–HSR–0118–12–01–01, which was established between the California High-Speed Rail Authority and the Federal Railroad Administration. The bill's primary purpose is to cut off federal funding for this particular transportation initiative.
